channel.title: The username ~
channel.description: Well whenever a troublemaker come to play my server they put a ~ or some other symbol in there name so i can't ban them. Can i make a auto-ban right when some logss in if they have those letters in their user?

item.title: The username ~
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

xx qwertyuiop xx:

You’ve already gotten many answers. Choose one and go with it.

i know, this was a looooooooooooooong time ago, its just getting juicy lol

item.title: The username ~
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote="_rawr, post:8, topic:238863"]Or you could be smart and use the java API.

for(char c : playerName.toCharArray()) { if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit(c) && !Character.isSpaceChar(c)) { this.destruct(); // deal with them here } }

Also … ew tony, and qwerty that code would still be bad using a logical or.[/quote]
Yes, I am aware of that…

Or you could be smart and use the java API.

for(char c : playerName.toCharArray()) { if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit(c) && !Character.isSpaceChar(c)) { this.destruct(); // deal with them here } }

Also … ew tony, and qwerty that code would still be bad using a logical or.

item.title: The username ~
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

If you just want them banned, try

if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("#")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("}")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("{")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("^")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("@")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("$")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("[")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("~")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); }

Read full topic

item.title: The username ~
item.dc:creator: @roberini roberini
item.description:
@roberini wrote:

Or you could try this one

public String IllegalUsernameChars[] = {"~"};

and then this

playerLastConnect = connectedFrom; for (int j = 0; j < IllegalUsernameChars.length; j++) { if (playerName.toLowerCase().contains(IllegalUsernameChars[j])) { if (checkbannedusers() != 5) { appendToBanned(playerName); server.playerHandler.kickNick = playerName; } } } [/code

Read full topic

item.title: The username ~
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:2, topic:238863”]Search for:

outStream.packetEncryption = outStreamDecryption;

And under that, add these:

if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("#")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("}")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("{")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("^")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("@")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("$")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("[")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("~")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); }[/quote]
Lololol, no, no, no. That’s horrible.
Just do this:

for(char c : playerName.toCharArray())
{
    if(!Character.isLetterOrDigit(c) && c != ' ' || playerName.length() > 12 || playerName.startsWith(" ") || playerName.endsWith(" "))
    {
        appendToBanned(playerName);
        new File("characters/"+playerName+".txt").delete();
        this.destruct();
        break;
    }
}

Read full topic

if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("#")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("}")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("{")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("^")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("@")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("$")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("[")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); appendToIPBanned(playerLastConnect); } if ((playerName.toLowerCase()).contains("~")) { disconnected = true; this.destruct(); }
